member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IDOMObject
member.summary: Represents an object in a Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API document-tree.
member.remarks:
Cloning and Serialization Non-abstract implementations of IDOMObject are required to provide a parameterless constructor in order for Clone() to function.
Implementations must be serializable, as must any types they depend on to store values; typically these are the fields which are copied by Clone().
Disposal IDOMObject is an , and as such instances of it should be disposed of when finished with. If an IDOMObject is a child of another, disposing of it will remove it from its parent.
If the document-tree is frozen, disposal may only take place at the root of the tree; calling Dispose() on any other member of the tree will cause an to be thrown.
Once disposed, all members of the IDOMObject will throw when accessed unless otherwise noted.
Self-description IDOMObjects may be either mutable or immutable on creation. Mutable objects may become immutable during their lifetime by being frozen; immutable objects stay that way forever.
A frozen object will throw an when any attempt is made to modify it. An immutable object, unless also frozen, will throw a when any attempt is made to modify it. Frozen objects which are a member of a document-tree may only be disposed by disposing the entire tree.
IDOMObject returns the following values:
PropertyValue
Implementation-specific
Implementation-specific

member.name: M:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IDOMObject.Freeze
member.summary: Freezes the .
member.exception: The is disposed.
member.remarks:
If the has no immediate ancestor in the document-tree, it will be frozen explicitly; otherwise the tree is traversed to its root and the top-most object is frozen. As an is frozen implicitly when its immediate ancestor is frozen, calling this method on any member of a document-tree will have the effect of freezing the entire tree.
An that is frozen may not be modified in any way, including adding it to or removing it from a collection, and attempting to do so will cause an to be thrown. Freezing is permanent: a frozen can not be unfrozen.
An immutableÂ may be frozen.
Calling Freeze() on an already-frozen will have no effect.

member.name: E:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IDOMObject.Changed
member.summary: Occurs when the changes in some way.
member.remarks:
Whenever a property-specific or action-specific event is raised by the , this event will also be sent, with its property set to the name of the specific event that occurred. This event may thus be subscribed to as an alternative to subscribing individually to each of the specific events.
If the has child objects, their Changed events will be forwarded on through this event too.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IDOMObject.IsDisposing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the is currently being disposed of.
member.remarks:
This returns true if either the or its parent (if any) is currently being disposed of by a call to Dispose(), and false at any other time. Subtypes of should use this value to determine how much, if any, of their resources need to be disposed of.
When Dispose() is invoked, the should take the following actions:
set IsDisposing to true
if it has a parent object in the document-tree whose IsDisposing property is false, it should remove itself from the parent
clean up any locally-held resources
dispose of any children
set to true
set IsDisposing to false
Whilst it is not an error for an to explicitly remove itself from a parent object which is in the process of being disposed, it is usually unnecessary and may result in performance problems so should be avoided.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IDOMObject.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the has been disposed of.
member.remarks:
Following a successful call to Dispose(), this property will return true. Any attempt to modify the or access its properties (other than this one) after this point will result in an being thrown.
It is safe to call Dispose() if this property is true; doing so will have no effect.
Note to implementors: this must be supported. Each property or method which modifies the must check the value of IsDisposed before proceeding, and throw an if it is true.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IDOMObject.IsFrozen
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the is frozen.
member.exception: The is disposed.
member.remarks:
An that is frozen may not be modified in any way, including adding it to or removing it from a collection, and attempting to do so will cause an to be thrown. Freezing is permanent: a frozen can not be unfrozen.
An is frozen implicitly if its immediate ancestor in the document-tree is frozen.
The value of this property is not preserved when the is cloned.
For convenience, this property will return false if is true in order to simplify implementing Dispose().
Default value is false.
Note to implementors: this must be supported. Each property or method which modifies the must check the value of IsFrozen before proceeding, and throw an if it is true. If the is disposed then this must be checked for first and the appropriate exception thrown, as this takes precedence over IsFrozen. If overriding this property, you must OR your value with that returned by the superclass.

member.name: M:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IDocumentElement.Analyse(Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.CodeStandards)
member.summary: Checks the for problems.
member.exception: The is disposed.
member.param: The mode to run the checks in.
member.returns: A collection of s describing any problems detected with the .
member.remarks:
The values for are hierarchical: is a superset of , which is a superset of . is thus the most lax and the most strict. In general, the following will be reported for each mode:
Anything that contravenes the LDraw.org File Format specification. Deprecated syntax will be reported as s, all others as s.
As for , plus anything that contravenes the LDraw.org File Format Restrictions for the Official Library. Deprecated syntax will be reported as s, all others as s.
Some issues reported as s when in mode may have their severity increased to .
As for , plus anything that contravenes the Official Model Repository (OMR) Specification. Deprecated syntax will be reported as s, all others as s.
Some issues reported as s when in or mode may have their severity increased to .
This method may be expensive to call, depending on what processing the has to carry out to build the collection. To find out whether there are any problems without incurring the possible overheads of Analyse(), see .
If is false, this method returns an empty .

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IPageElement.IsLocked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the may be modified.
member.exception: The is disposed.
The property is set and the is frozen.
The property is set and the is locked implicitly.
The property is set and the is immutable.
member.remarks:
An may be locked explicitly by setting the value of this property to true, or implicitly by locking any of its ancestors in the document-tree. This property will return true in both cases: to determine which is the case, see .
If the is locked explicitly, it is always possible to change the value of this property. If the is locked implicitly, or is frozen either explicitly or implicitly, the value of this property may not be changed.
An that is locked does not allow modification of its properties or, if it is a collection of other elements, additions to or removals from the collection. The may itself be added to or removed from a collection, however. It may also be frozen.
Any attempt to modify a locked will cause an to be thrown.
Raises the event when its value changes.
For convenience, this property will return false if is true in order to simplify implementing Dispose().
Default value is false.
Note to implementors: this must be supported. Each property or method which modifies the must check the value of IsLocked before proceeding, and throw an if it is true. If the is disposed, immutable or frozen then these must be checked for first (and in that order) and the appropriate exceptions thrown, as these take precedence over this property. If overriding this property, you must OR your value with that returned by the superclass.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IMetaCommand
member.summary: Represents an LDraw meta-command.
member.remarks:
This is the base-type for all meta-commands which do not generate graphical elements (for these, see ) and which do not appear in the header section of an LDraw file (for these, see the properties of ).
Implementations of IMetaCommand must be decorated with a number of s:
Required for the plugins-system to discover the class. Must have the value typeof(IMetaCommand), and may appear only once.
Specifies the type-name of the IMetaCommand. This is usually set to the same value as . May appear only once.
Specifies the icon used to represent instances of the IMetaCommand. This is usually set to the same value as . May appear only once.
Specifies a regular-expression which will match the LDraw code of the meta-command. Must appear at least once, and must specify the full text of the meta-command - for example, "^0\s+CLEAR\s*$".
Like all pluggable s, implementations of IMetaCommand must provide a constructor which takes a single parameter of type and which is interpreted as the LDraw code required to instantiate the meta-command.
[Export(typeof(IMetaCommand)] [DefaultIcon(typeof(Resources), "ClearIcon")] [TypeName(typeof(Resources), "ClearTypeName")] [MetaCommandPattern(@"^0\s+CLEAR\s*$")] public class MyMetaCommand : IMetaCommand { public MyMetaCommand() { // default ctor, required for IDOMObject.Clone() to function }
public MyMetaCommand(string ldrawCode) { // LDraw-code ctor, required for all pluggable elements }
... }

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IPage
member.summary: Represents a section of an LDraw document as defined in the LDraw.org File Format specification.
member.remarks:
An IPage is the basic component of an , which normally contains at least one page. Pages are collections of s, which in turn contain s which represent the page's geometry, meta-commands and so on.
The fields of an LDraw file's header are exposed as a set of properties on the IPage.
Code-generation ToCode() iterates over the contents of the IPage and generates code for each in turn, passing in the parameters it was given.
If is , calling ToCode() with a codeFormat of will cause an to be thrown.
If is anything other than , calling ToCode() with a codeFormat of will have the same effect as calling it with a codeFormat of .
Collection-management In addition to the restrictions imposed by IDOMObjectCollection<T>.CanReplace(), an may only be added to an IPage if:
The IPage is not frozen
The IPage is not immutable
The IPage is not read-only
The insert does not violate any of the restrictions of
The members of will throw exceptions for the following conditions, checked for in this order:
The IPage is disposed
- or -
The to be inserted is disposed
The IPage is frozen
- or -
The to be inserted is frozen
The IPage is immutable
- or -
The IPage is read-only
An attempt was made to insert a null value into the IPage
The insert is prohibited by any of the other restrictions imposed by CanReplace()
Implementations of IPage may add further restrictions.
When adding or removing s, the IPage will raise one of , , or and each will raise . These events will also be raised via the IPage's event, but are not guaranteed to appear in any particular order.
Disposal Disposing an IPage will automatically remove it from its and dispose of its descendants. If the document-tree is , or is immutable or read-only, will throw the appropriate exception and the disposal will not take place.
Geometry The of an IPage is , and its is the current value of .

member.summary: Sets from the supplied LDraw code.
member.exception: The supplied code was not valid LDraw colour code.
member.param: The LDraw code representing the colour-value.
member.remarks:
This is provided largely for the benefit of subclass constructors which parse lines of LDraw code. It handles values in the following formats:
SetColourValue("1"); // set ColourValue to a Code, from either the system-palette or an IColour in the document-tree SetColourValue("#2FF0000"); // set ColourValue to an opaque Direct Colours value of fully-saturated red SetColourValue("0x2FF0000"); // the same as above but with the '0x' prefix SetColourValue("50266112"); // the same as above but in base-10

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.Library.LibraryManager
member.summary: Represents the LDraw library installed on this computer.

remarks.para: LibraryManager provides two functions: an event which reports when items are added to or removed from the installed library, or are modified or renamed; and a cache to speed up access to the items in the library.
On startup, LibraryManager installs a to monitor for changes to any component of the . It detects files and folders being added, removed, modified or renamed and raises the event when this occurs.

The cache indexes the contents of the installed library and returns a collection of s. The cache may be initalised by calling , and if successful is made available via . When occurs, the cache will update itself. This cache is also written automatically to global Isolated Storage to speed up indexing the next time it is loaded.
If the cache is loaded, will make use of it when resolving its . The cache also provides the of the LDraw library, and lists of the categories found in it.

Finally, whilst the DOM itself does not use the parts.lst file, older LDraw programs may still rely on it. LibraryManager provides APIs to write this file from the cached data, and can optionally update it automatically when the cache updates.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourOpaque
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is an opaque Direct Colours value.

remarks.para: An opaque Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x02, bits 23-16 specify the Red component, bits 15-8 specify the Green component and bits 7-0 specify the Blue component. Alpha is 255.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourTransparent
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is a transparent Direct Colours value.

remarks.para:
A transparent Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x03, bits 23-16 specify the Red component, bits 15-8 specify the Green component and bits 7-0 specify the Blue component. Alpha is .
Transparent Direct Colours values are not permitted in official files.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourOpaqueDithered
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is an opaque dithered Direct Colours value.

remarks.para: A dithered opaque Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x04, bits 23-20 specify the first Red component, bits 19-16 specify the first Green component, bits 15-12 specify the first Blue component, bits 11-8 specify the second Red component, bits 7-4 specify the second Green component and bits 3-0 specify the second Blue component. The final colour value is a 50-50 blend of the two 12-bit RGB values with an alpha-value of 255.
remarks.note: Dithered Direct Colours values are not permitted in official files.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourTransparentDithered
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is a transparent dithered Direct Colours value.

remarks.para: A dithered transparent Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x05, bits 23-20 specify the Red component, bits 19-16 specify the Green component, bits 15-12 specify the Blue component, and bits 11-0 are unused. The final colour value is the 12-bit RGB value promoted to 24-bit and with an alpha-value of .
remarks.note: Dithered Direct Colours values are not permitted in official files.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourTransparentDitheredAlt
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is a transparent dithered Direct Colours value.

remarks.para: A dithered transparent Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x06, bits 23-16 are unused, bits 15-12 specify the Red component, bits 11-8 specify the Green component and bits 7-0 specify the Blue component. The final colour value is the 12-bit RGB value promoted to 24-bit and with an alpha-value of .
remarks.note: Dithered Direct Colours values are not permitted in official files.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IStep
member.summary: Represents an LDraw STEP meta-command as defined in the LDraw.org File Format specification, or an MLCad ROTSTEP meta-command as defined in the MLCad specifications.
member.remarks:
Code-generation ToCode() generates code as defined by IElementCollection. If codeFormat is or then either the STEP or ROTSTEP meta-command will be appended. Certain combinations of values for , , and will be optimised:
Output
0.00.00.00 STEP
0.00.00.00 ROTSTEP END
If the IStep is locked explicitly the '0 !DIGITALIS_LDTOOLS_DOM LOCKNEXT' meta-command will be appended immediately before the STEP or ROTSTEP.
If the IStep is the last member of an and would normally output 0 STEP then this will be suppressed as the meta-command would have no effect in this position.
Disposal Disposing of an IStep will automatically remove it from its and dispose of its descendants. If the document-tree is , or is immutable or read-only, will throw the appropriate exception and the disposal will not take place.
Document-tree always returns null.
Self-description IStep returns the following values:
PropertyValue
Implementation-specific
Implementation-specific
Implementation-specific
Implementation-specific
Implementation-specific
true
true if is true; otherwise implementation-specific

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IElementCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of s.
member.remarks:
Code-generation ToCode() iterates over the contents of the IElementCollection and generates code for each in turn, passing in the parameters it was given. s and s with a of will be treated as if the IElementCollection was an : that is, if overrideColour is set to anything other than or the / code will use the complement of the specified colour. If this is not an index into the current palette then it will be converted to a Direct Colours value. If overrideColour is itself a Direct Colours value then the complement is defined as #2000000.
If codeFormat is the resulting LDraw code will be optimised by eliminating or modifying elements which would either have no effect or else simply change the winding-direction.
Code-generation for the property is implementation-specific.
Collection-management In addition to the restrictions imposed by IDOMObjectCollection<T>.CanReplace(), an may only be added to an IElementCollection if:
The IElementCollection is not frozen
The IElementCollection is not immutable
The IElementCollection is not read-only
It would not create a circular reference; for example, an whose is the to which it is being added
It is not a top-level element, unless the IElementCollectionÂ allows these
It is not a Direct ColoursÂ
Additionally, an may only be added if the containing or , if any, does not already contain an with the same .
Specifying in the flags parameter of CanReplace() allows you to determine whether an may be added to a lockedÂ IElementCollection without having to first unlock.
The members of will throw exceptions for the following conditions, checked for in this order:
The IElementCollection is disposed
- or -
The to be inserted is disposed
The IElementCollection is frozen
- or -
The to be inserted is frozen
The IElementCollection is immutable

The IDocument is disposed

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.ITexmap
member.summary: Represents an LDraw !TEXMAP meta-command as defined in the Language Extension for Texture Mapping.
member.remarks:
Analytics IsDuplicateOf() is not supported by ITexmap and always returns false.
Attributes ITexmap implements and as 'meta' properties: setting them will apply the specified value to each member of , and rather than to the ITexmap itself. When getting the property values, will return false if all s in each of the three collections are currently not visible, and true otherwise; will return true if all s in each collection are currently ghosted, and false otherwise. If the ITexmap does not contain any s then will return true and will return false.
The and events will function as normal and will be raised whenever the values of and change regardless of whether the change was caused by the property being set on the ITexmap or by one of the s it contains having its property changed directly.
Code-generation ToCode() generates code as defined in the Language Extension for Texture Mapping.
If none of , or have content, or if is false or is true, and codeFormat is then no code will be generated.
Collection-management In order to simplify renderers which do not support texturing, ITexmap implements as a read-only accessor over the contents of its and collections. is specifically excluded from this behaviour; thus a renderer may simply treat an ITexmap as an and draw the non-textured version of its graphics without needing to understand the semantics of !TEXMAP.
As a read-only implementation of , all the mutator APIs will throw when invoked, and the collection-change events are inactive. CanInsert() and CanReplace() will always return .
When accessing the members of the ITexmap, the contents of will be returned first, followed by those of .

member.summary: Represents an MLCad GROUP element as defined in the MLCad specifications.
member.remarks:
An IGroup is a means of associating one or more s in an for ease of manipulation or editing. The elements remain members of their containing page, and are attached to the group either by setting their property or by calling the members of . An may only be added to an IGroup if returns true; if this is not the case then attempting to add the will cause an to be thrown.
Cloning and Serialization As an IGroup does not contain the s but is merely an accessor over them, cloning or serializing it does not copy the s.
Code-generation If the IGroup is not empty and codeFormat is or , ToCode() will append the GROUP meta-command.
Disposal Disposing an IGroup will automatically clear the property of any s associated with it. The s will not be disposed.

remarks.para: To speed up loading and to save resources, LDReference maintains a cache of s which have been loaded in order to resolve . The cache itself is private, but events are available to notify interested parties when cache-entries are added and removed.
The cache is thread-safe, and s in it are frozen.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IReference
member.summary: Represents an LDraw sub-file reference as defined in the LDraw.org File Format specification.
member.remarks:
Initially, an IReference just holds the of the sub-file to which it refers. This may eventually be resolved to an actual , either in the same as the IReference or in a separate file entirely.
Analytics IsDuplicateOf() will return true if graphic is an instance of IReference and has the same values for , and .
Code-generation ToCode() will generate a single LDraw sub-file reference statement whose values are determined by , and . If is true the statement will be prefixed with the BFC INVERTNEXT meta-command, and if is true the entire statement including BFC INVERTNEXT if present will be prefixed with the !DIGITALIS_LDTOOLS_DOM LOCKNEXT meta-command.
The winding parameter is not used by IReferences and will have no effect.
If is false or is true and codeFormat is then no code will be generated; otherwise the quadrilateral statement will be prefixed with the MLCAD HIDE and GHOST meta-commands as required.
If is not equal to then the generated code will output ; otherwise it will output according to the following rules:
Value of overrideColourOutput value
A Direct Colours value
The specified value in upper-case hexadecimal format, prefixed with an #
For example, #2FF0000
The of an entry in the
The specified value in base-10 format
The of an in the containing
If codeFormat is , the 's converted to Direct Colours format; otherwise the specified value in base-10 format
If codeFormat is and the 's property is true then instead of the sub-file reference statement, the members of will be output as LDraw code. ToCode() is called on each member in turn with the following parameters:
overrideColour
If the IReference's is not equal to its then it is passed; otherwise the original overrideColour value is passed
transform The original transform passed to the IReference multiplied by
winding
If the original value passed to the IReference is then this is passed down; otherwise or is passed as required to conform the 's winding-direction to that of the IReference
If the IReference is BFC-enabled and the is not, then BFC NOCLIP / BFC CLIP meta-commands will be placed around the inlined code. If the is BFC-enabled and the IReference is not, the 's BFC meta-commands will be omitted.
Geometry The of an IReference is the bounding-box of its , which will be resolved if necessary. If cannot be resolved then an empty is returned.
The of an IReference is the (x, y, z) component of .
ReverseWinding() toggles the value of .

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.IReference.TargetStatus
member.summary: Gets the status of .
member.exception: The is disposed.
member.remarks:
The value returned indicates whether is currently resolved, or else the reason why it is not. As resolving may be an expensive operation, checking the value returned is an efficient means of determining whether is currently available. The possible return values are:
No attempt has been made to resolve since the last time was set
The last attempt to resolve could not find a file matching
The last attempt to resolve found a file that would create a circular-dependency if loaded
The last attempt to resolve found a file that could not be loaded because it was not a valid LDraw file
The last attempt to resolve was successful
This status is updated each time performs a resolve. It is reset to when is changed or ClearTarget() is called, or when an event occurs that requires Target to be cleared.
The value of this property is not preserved when the is cloned or serialized.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.API.MetaCommandPatternAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a regular-expression which can be used to identify a line of LDraw code supported by an .

remarks.para: This attribute must be specified at least once on the type, and may be specified as many times as required to cover all the options supported by the type. It must be a string suitable for passing to , and may match all or part of a single line of LDraw code. It is recommended that the pattern be as inclusive as possible to reduce the risk of an ambiguous match.
If the class supports more than one meta-command, or if a single pattern would be too complex to write, the attribute may be specified as many times as required to cover all cases.
This attribute is only relevant to implementations of , and is required to appear at least once.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDPage.NameFormatProblem
member.summary: Specifies the problems found with during analysis.

remarks.para: Other than the restrictions imposed by the filesystem, is free-form. However, for certain s of it should conform to a specific format and should not contain characters disallowed by the File Format Restrictions for the Official Library.

The following formats are recognised by , and will check for them:
[prefix]nnnnn[suffix][pattern-marker][shortcut-marker]
nnnnn[suffix]
nnnnn
[prefix]nnnnn[suffix][pattern-marker][shortcut-marker]
nnnnn
[prefix]nnnnn[suffix][pattern-marker][shortcut-marker]
[prefix]nnnnn[suffix][pattern-marker]subpart-marker
where:
prefix is one of u, x or s
nnnnn is one or more digits
suffix is any letter
pattern-marker is a p followed by two or more letters or digits; the letters i, l, o and p may only be used if the first character after the p is a t, a u or a v
shortcut-marker is a c or a d followed by two or more digits
subpart-marker is an s followed by two or more digits
and [...] denotes that the token is optional. For all other s, is free-form.

member.seealso: LDraw.org Parts Tracker Patterned Part Information
Parts numbering scheme for parts with unknown numbers

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDTranslationCatalog.MovedToTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template to use when translating a "~Moved to" .
member.exception: is not .
The supplied value is incorrectly formatted.

remarks.para: If is and the key passed to is in the form "~Moved to {name}", where "{name}" is an arbitrary string, then it is not required that an explicit match exist in the for a translation to be returned; instead, if no explicit match can be found, the translated string can be constructed automatically using the key and the value of this property.

To enable this behaviour, the property must be set to a string which contains the character-sequence {0}. It must contain the sequence exactly once, and may not contain any other instances of the { or } characters. The sequence may appear at any point in the string. If the string is absent or invalid automatic translation will be disabled, and "~Moved to" keys will only be translated if they have an explict match in the .
Default value is null.

member.name: M:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDDocument.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader,System.String,Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.ParserProgressCallback,Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.ParseFlags,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a stream.
member.param: The stream to read data from.
The path of the LDraw file that will represent if saved. May not be null or empty.
A delegate to be notified of the progress of the load, or null if no notifications are required.
Flags to control the behaviour of the parser.
Returns a value indicating whether the document was modified during loading.
member.exception: A problem occurred reading the stream.
was null.
was whitespace or did not end with one of .ldr, .dat or .mpd.
The delegate cancelled the load.
The stream contained two s with identical s.
The stream was not recognised as LDraw data.
The stream contained a circular reference.
The stream contained a syntax-error.

remarks.para:
The data loaded from will be sanitised:
trailing empty comments are removed from each
blocks of empty comments are collapsed down to a single empty comment
invalid duplicated lines in the page header are converted into comments
if the or of a page conflicts with the page's , it will be fixed

If is not null then it will be called periodically as the stream is parsed. Two types of callback message are sent:
if progress is -1 then name is the of the first in the document, or if the page has no title
if progress is 0..100 then name is a description of the currently being loaded

The parser may need to modify the document during loading, either in order to follow the rules specified by or to correct errors in the document's structure. If this happens, will be set to true before returning. The underlying file referenced by will be unchanged.

The following occurrences will cause a modification:
specifies and an is encountered which refers to a ~Moved to file; the reference's will be changed to the of the new file
specifies and an is encountered which refers to an or ; the reference's will be changed to the of the aliased file
an is encountered whose begins with an x but for which the referenced file has been renamed from xNNNNN to NNNNN, where NNNNN is the 'base' name of the part the file represents; the reference's will be changed to the new name
an is loaded whose Name: and !LDRAW_ORG fields are invalid or inconsistent; the page's will be changed to a correct value, and any s in the document will be updated with this value
events will not be raised by this method.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.Configuration.LDrawBase
member.summary: Gets or sets the path of the LDraw base folder.
member.exception: The ldconfig.ldr file cannot be read.
One of the required folders cannot be found.

remarks.para:
This is the folder where the LDraw parts library is stored, and is required to contain at least the following items:
ldconfig.ldr
\Parts
\Parts\S
\P
\P\48
On loading, the DLL attempts to locate the LDraw base folder by checking the following locations in order:
The value stored in the application's Application Settings file
The user's LDraw.ini file
C:\LDraw
The user's home folder
The user's My Documents folder
The Program Files folder
If any of these is found to contain a valid LDraw library, it will be used.
The value is persisted in the calling application's Application Settings file. Applications are recommended to provide the user with a means to set the value.
Raises the event when its value changes.

Valid range is 0..15. Defaults to 4.
